quiz.question: What’s your reaction to stupid news?
options: Share it immediately on social media
Check a trusted news source for details
Wait to see how the story develops
Ignore it unless it impacts you directly

quiz.question: What’s your reaction to breaking news?
options: Share it immediately on social media
Check a trusted news source for details
Wait to see how the story develops
Ignore it unless it impacts you directly

quiz.question: How do you usually get your news?
options: Social media posts, reels, and viral content
Quick news summaries and short articles
In-depth news reports and investigative articles
Conversations with family, friends, or colleagues

quiz.question: How do you prefer your news to be presented?
options: Fun, engaging, and entertaining
Quick and easy to understand
Detailed, well-researched, and analytical
Through conversation and discussion

quiz.question: What motivates you to read the news?
options: Entertainment and passing time
Staying updated but without spending too much time
Staying well-informed and analyzing key issues
A specific event or topic sparks my interest

quiz.question: How do you handle controversial news?
options: Post my opinion online immediately
Observe but avoid debating
Look for expert opinions and multiple perspectives
Talk it out with friends or family to form an opinion

quiz.question: Do you subscribe to any news platforms or channels?
options: No, I rely on whatever I come across online
I follow free online platforms and newsletters
Yes, I actively subscribe to premium news sites or deep-dive content
I don’t subscribe, but I stay informed through discussions

quiz.question: When a friend shares news with you, what do you do?
options: Share it immediately if it seems interesting
Read it but wait to share until verified
Search for similar stories to confirm accuracy
Discuss it with friends before deciding what to believe
